pageContext.claim: “He had a bad day. When he sends a letter out and he sends copies all over the place and it's not a classified letter....he did a bad thing, sending a letter out and many, many copies, as you know. I don't know, I heard 28 copies. I heard a lot.”
pageContext.analysis: This was incorrect. Capt. Brett Crozier, commanding officer of the aircraft carrier Theodore Roosevelt, proposed that Navy officials order the evacuation of the majority of the ship’s sailors after an outbreak of covid-19. His letter was attached to an email. The email, which was copied to seven other Navy captains, was primarily addressed to Crozier’s commanding officer, Rear Adm. Stuart Baker, U.S. Pacific Fleet commander Adm. John Aquilino, and Naval Air Forces commander Vice Adm. DeWolfe Miller.
